title: How to Perform Well in Call of Duty: Zombie Mode

steps.headline: Assess the map that you are performing on.
steps.description: Is it small? Very large? Knowing the size of the map itself can be of great assistance to the player/players. Knowing the routes, doors and rooms of the map can show you where weapons are available and Perk-a-Colas.

steps.headline: Purchase weapons.
steps.description: If you have enough Credits, purchase weapons off the wall if available; many go for the option of using the Random Weapons Box and usually get a poor quality weapon. Also, many weapons that are mounted on the wall have good capability and power, for example , the Trench Gun is very good until Round 11 and further.

steps.headline: Use a good quality weapon until it has completely been stripped of ammunition.
steps.description: You can also upgrade/Pack-a-Punch the weapon, as it can turn an ineffective gun into a Zombie Eradicator.

steps.headline: Know what zombies you are up against.
steps.description: Are they regular Zombies? Hellhounds? Gas Zombies? All of them have their weaknesses. Hellhounds are weaker than the zombies of a current round, so using the weaker sidearm is best for them. This also applies to the Gas Zombies too.

steps.headline: Do not go for Headshots intentionally.
steps.description: You will waste valuable rounds of ammunition and they may corner you because of the time that is being chewed up while trying to be accurate. Only do it if you have the time, they are at walking pace or you need lots of Credits.

steps.headline: Only camp in the toughest of situations.
steps.description: The zombies tend to corner you a lot if you camp.
